The Daughter of the Drowned Serpent — by Tim Hitchcock — The wicked child of an ancient foe plots to return her father to his throne unless the heroes can intervene to stop her terrible plan from coming to fruition.

The Daughter of the Drowned Serpent — by Tim Hitchcock — The wicked child of an ancient foe plots to return her father to his throne unless the heroes can intervene to stop her terrible plan from coming to fruition.

boardgame.name: Closed Fists
boardgame.description:
From the itch.io page:
A small, simple, and fast game about resolving conflict with violence, technique, and luck for 2+ players.

Set the scene, create fighters, pick techniques and roll dice to see who comes out on top.

Inspirations
Kitchen Contest by Hans Chun
Street Fighter Mas by Kamasi Washington
Shadow (2018)
Crouching Tiger Hidden Dragon (2000)
Kung Fu Hustle (2004)

boardgame.name: The Hidden Shrine of Tmocanotz (S&W)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Hidden Shrine of Tmocanotz is an adventure, that introduces them to an old foe making an appearance in the forsaken Izmalli Swamp on the island of Tehuatl. In a subterranean and partially submerged complex beneath the ground, the deranged worshippers of a foul deity have made a sudden and unexpected resurgence in their efforts to spread madness and wickedness beyond their isolated corner of the wetlands.

boardgame.name: The Hidden Shrine of Tmocanotz (PF)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Hidden Shrine of Tmocanotz is an adventure, that introduces them to an old foe making an appearance in the forsaken Izmalli Swamp on the island of Tehuatl. In a subterranean and partially submerged complex beneath the ground, the deranged worshippers of a foul deity have made a sudden and unexpected resurgence in their efforts to spread madness and wickedness beyond their isolated corner of the wetlands.

boardgame.name: The Hidden Shrine of Tmocanotz (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Hidden Shrine of Tmocanotz is an adventure, that introduces them to an old foe making an appearance in the forsaken Izmalli Swamp on the island of Tehuatl. In a subterranean and partially submerged complex beneath the ground, the deranged worshippers of a foul deity have made a sudden and unexpected resurgence in their efforts to spread madness and wickedness beyond their isolated corner of the wetlands.

boardgame.name: Maize and Monsters (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Maize and Monsters is an adventure, that exposes the adventurers to the grim reality that time sometimes exacerbates old wounds rather than healing them. A recent murder in the village of Pilhua proves to be far more than a simple crime of passion as the seeds for this killing were sown during a previous, unsolved mystery that still haunts some residents within the settlement. The characters must wade through a list of suspects and motives that lead them to discover the ugly truth about a heinous crime that spawned a greater evil than even its perpetrators could ever imagine.

boardgame.name: Maize and Monsters (PF)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Maize and Monsters is an adventure, that exposes the adventurers to the grim reality that time sometimes exacerbates old wounds rather than healing them. A recent murder in the village of Pilhua proves to be far more than a simple crime of passion as the seeds for this killing were sown during a previous, unsolved mystery that still haunts some residents within the settlement. The characters must wade through a list of suspects and motives that lead them to discover the ugly truth about a heinous crime that spawned a greater evil than even its perpetrators could ever imagine.

boardgame.name: Sine Requie Anno XIII: Templari
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:
This manual explores the world of the Templars, the indomitable Knights of the Temple, protectors of the Pope and defenders of the good people of the Sanctum Imperium from the ferocity of the Dead.

boardgame.name: Slum Town (2.0 - 5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play. An invaluable addition to any GM's armoury.

Tired of your towns and cities being boring, bland places in which your PCs show little or no interest? Want to bring them alive with cool, interesting minor features of note? Then Urban Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different kind of town and gives harried GMs the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and noteworthy features.

This instalment of Urban Dressing presents loads of great details to customise the pirate towns in your campaign.

This Urban Dressing presents:

One table (100 entries) presenting the town's sights and sounds.
One table (100 entries) presenting sample businesses.
One table (100 entries) presenting folk to encounter around town.
One table (20 entries) presenting hooks, complications and opportunities.

boardgame.name: Slum Town (2.0 - OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play. An invaluable addition to any GM's armoury.

Tired of your towns and cities being boring, bland places in which your PCs show little or no interest? Want to bring them alive with cool, interesting minor features of note? Then Urban Dressing is for you! Each instalment in the line focuses on a different kind of town and gives harried GMs the tools to bring such locales to life with interesting and noteworthy features.

This instalment of Urban Dressing presents loads of great details to customise the pirate towns in your campaign.

One table (100 entries) presenting sample businesses.
One table (100 entries) presenting folk to encounter around town.
One table (20 entries) presenting hooks, complications and opportunities.

boardgame.name: Champions of Order
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Champions of Order gives players a wealth of new options for creating characters for Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Soulbound and features new Archetypes, new Talents, and devastating new spells. It’s packed with content and options to expand on your Soulbound game. The book includes:

An expanded look at the Soulbound and their history, details on the mysterious Binding ritual that links the heroes’ souls together, and tables filled with sample Short- and Long-term Goals for your hero.

A brand new faction, complete with Archetypes — The Lumineth Realm-Lords, Aelves from the Realm of Light!

New Archetypes, as well as rules for playing sub-factions such as the Anvils of the Heldenhammer of the Stormcast, the Ironwood Glade of the Sylvaneth, the Kraith of the Daughters of Khaine, and many more!

Almost 100 new Talents and 50 new Miracles to further customise and develop your hero!
Over 40 devastating new spells to unleash, including a brand new Lore of Magic — the Lore of the High Peaks!
Over 30 new Endeavours to undertake between adventures, as well as over a dozen new contacts players can make, from Collegiate Scholars to Kharadron Endrineers.

boardgame.name: Van Helsing Society
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The players take on the roles of vampires hunted by a small but relentless band of slayers from the Van Helsing Society, a clandestine organization created by Dr. Abraham Van Helsing himself.

boardgame.name: Back to the Rifter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In 1990, Palladium Books launched Rifts, a post-apocalyptic-science-fantasy-horror-mecha-role-playing game using a game system from 1981.

In 2021, two guys who played it a bunch revisited the game and, armed with hindsight, set about mocking, parodying, and critiquing the game. It turned into this embarrassingly long book.

Coverage of the basic rules, the nearly 30 (i.e. 27) classes, psionics, magic, the Rifts Earth setting, gear, and what passes for the gamemaster section.
Insights into the game's history and inner workings.
Snarky jokes and humorous tables and lists, like a class generator, random skull armor, bests and worsts, plus a Palladium Bingo card!
The Glitterskull R.C.C. and playbook, letting you play as the "mascot" of the game at long last.
Magic & Missiles, a fully playable one-page RPG!
Over 200 superfluous footnotes.
An in-depth criticism of the game's Nazi apologism. It's worse than you think, and we brought receipts.

boardgame.name: Ilaris
boardgame.description:
Schlanke Regeln für Aventurier

Publisher's blurb:

Ilaris is a lean and fast rules system for playing in Aventuria.

This revised and expanded second version offers all the important rules for playing in Aventuria: Choose from six different fighting styles, strengthen your allies with commands, experience exciting chases, create sacred artifacts, or summon dark demons!

boardgame.name: Kabuto Sumo: Insect All-Stars
boardgame.description:
A new Sumo-Beya (stable of wrestlers) joins the league, the Insect All-Stars. This diverse cast of wrestlers makes the matches even more viscous and unpredictable. The giant beetles will have to adapt to these new aggressive challengers if they want to continue to be the last one standing in the ring.

This expansion adds 8 new wrestlers you may use in your games of Kabuto Sumo, each with a new signature piece. When players start a new game they may choose their wrestling persona from either the original wrestlers or any expansion wrestlers.

Some of these wrestlers use multiple copies of their signature piece. When using these wrestlers all copies of their signature piece are available to be gained and used in the same game.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Broken Bastion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A derelect spire stands landmark on the Crystal Frontier's Northern border. Glassy pink masonry shattered, pillars tumbled, and the entire edifice driven into the earth - an arrow from beyond the fixed stars. Ignored as too small and inaccessible by the larger bands of Gem Robbers, perhaps there's still treasures beneath the Broken Bastion's ruin?

GAZE upon arcane works of the Empyreans!
FLY from the ominous tread of thier War Automata!
SALVAGE wonders from beyond the terrestrial sphere!

A complete fourteen page mini-adventure for Level 3 characters designed for the upcoming Tomb Robbers of the Crystal Frontier setting, but ready to drop into almost any fantasy world. Broken Bastion is stated for the wayward offspring of older editions of the first roleplaying game and easily converted to retro-clones such as OSE.

Broken Bastion is an experimental adventure, a testbed of complex mechanics that create a high-risk environment for the adventurers within and includes a fair number of explanatory notes to assit Game Masters with these atypical mechanics.

boardgame.name: Archetypen für Ilaris
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Twelve ready-to-play archetypes with which you and your fellow players can immediately start your first adventure with Ilaris.

The ideas for these archetypes are the winners of the Ilaris archetypes competition and thus come from the community.

Hopefully this colorful hodgepodge of lovable, dark and mysterious archetypes will give you a lot of joy and a pleasant introduction to Ilaris.

boardgame.name: Änderungen an Ilaris
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The second version of Ilaris contains many, many changes and enhancements compared to the first, which we have summarized here. So you can see fairly quickly whether and how your characters are affected by the changes.

boardgame.name: The lost clans
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In a misty forest, you come by a warrior clan celebrating the acquisition of a magic charm.
But when hideous monsters come to spoil the party,
you realize you have stepped in a rivalry much older that you could imagine...

Every Monday, discover a new monster and its quick plot-hook : a psychic parasite, a cursed item, a monstrous insect....

"Monsters of the Week" is a series of scenario, quick to read and to add to your play nights, whether to complete an ongoing campaign, to start one or simply for a one-shot !
They are not written for a specific system or universe in order to let you modify and develop them at will.

Contains

a quick-to-read plot-hook,
exclusive illustration for the monster,
a description of the creature.



Dans une forêt brumeuse, vous croisez un clan de guerrier fêtant l’obtention d’une amulette magique. Mais quand des monstres hideux viennent gâcher la célébration, vous réalisez que vous venez de mettre les pieds dans une rivalité bien plus vieille que vous ne pourriez l’imaginer...

Chaque semaine, découvrez un nouveau monstre accompagnez de son amorce de scénario : un parasite psychique, un objet maudit, un insecte monstrueux...

"Monsters of the Week" est une série de scénarios rapide à lire et à incorporer dans vos soirées de jeux, que ce soit pour compléter une campagne, en commencer une ou simplement pour un one-shot !
Ils ne sont pas écrits pour un système ou un univers en particulier afin de vous permettre de les modifier et les développer à volonté.

Contient :

une amorce de scénario rapide à lire,
une illustration exclusive du monstre,
une description de la créature.

boardgame.name: Konvertierung von DSA nach Ilaris
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Would you like to play Ilaris, but not without your beloved characters? This conversion aid will help you with many practical tips on porting your hero to Ilaris.

boardgame.name: Sephrasto
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Sephrasto is a software generation tool for Ilaris. You can use it to create characters, compliant with the game rules. Created characters can be saved and/or transferred to the character sheet with one click.

boardgame.name: The Totality of Ygg
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Just outside the center of a lenticular galaxy a gas giant spins slowly around a dying star, holding five moons in its embrace. The natives of one of these moons have named their world Acheron, and their civilizations have risen and fallen for tens of thousands of years in the porphyry shadow of this Goliath. They worship a multitude of gods and debauch themselves in the ruins of their ancestors; outside the walls of their cities savagery abounds, and great treasures lie buried beneath the wreckage of time. Do you and your Band have what it takes to wrest these riches from the wastelands, or will you join the multitudes that lie beneath the rotting stones?

The Totality of Ygg is an OSR rules variant - "Dungeon Master" friendly, medium "crunch", old school feel.

boardgame.name: Forest Adventure
boardgame.description:
Forest Adventure is a new game what take you to new level of gaming.
The game has multiple difficulty levels, from child mode to strategic mode.

Two playing way!

1.Movement by Dice:

The game is started by the player who rolls the most dice. Successive players move clockwise.

If more than one player is on the same space, nothing happens. After completing your move, if you are standing on a square with a crate, take a card from the deck of adventure cards and follow the instructions on the card. If you stood on the action space, you execute the command from that space.

Rolling 6 points each time entitles you to extra move. Only rolling a different number of spots ends the turn.

2.Movements cards:

On strategic mode you use movement cards to move around the board - cards marked with dice.
This will give you connection between board game and card game with new oportunity of gameplay.


You went on a trip with friends. After setting up the camp, it turned out that on the way you lost a basket with provisions.
Additionally, one of the backpacks was torn and protective equipment against insects and other items helpful during the trip fell out of it.
You decide to find the lost basket with food in order to play by the camp fire in the evening.

The forest is full of surprises. You can stand face to face with a dangerous bear or meet poisonous snakes on your way.
However, not all obstacles are dangerous, be careful not to get distracted and get lost while listening to the beautiful voice of singing birds.
During the journey, you will also meet harmless animals, observing them and not disturbing them can help you find your way faster.
You will also have to cross dangerous canyons and swamps.

Some facts about the game, I think you should love it :

Game rules

The game is started by the player who rolls the most dice. Successive players move clockwise.
If more than one player is on the same space, nothing happens. After completing your move, if you are standing on a square with a crate, take a card from the deck of adventure cards and follow the instructions on the card. If you stood on the action space, you execute the command from that space.
Rolling 6 points each time entitles you to extra move. Only rolling a different number of spots ends the turn.
To complete the game, in the last move you need to roll as many stitches as you have left to the basket.

Difficulty level

With this game you can play on several difficult levels what make game more interested and tageted to everyone.
You can play with your yungest child 3+ or play with advanced players in strategic, coop or rivalry mode using standard dice or movement card.
The game can take 10 minutes on child mode or even couple hour on maximum difficulty level.

Normal level - Variant 1

In the basic variant of the game, the difficulty level is on the normal level - 5/10.

You play in classic style:
throw the dice -> move -> get the card if you stand on field with chest -> follow the instruction -> end turn

The length of the game oscillating about 15-30 minutes but depends on the player's luck and skill in throwing the dice, meetings with forest inhabitants and the collected equipment.

Some of example other level in game:

Child mode

Difficulty level - 1/10
This is the fastest game timeand can take 10 minute or less. This level is for everyone who want fast end or have children who can't sit on place more than 10 minute
The goal of the game is to reach the finish line as quickly as possible. You don't use any cards, all action spaces are neutral and nothing happens on them. The crossroads are also neutral, and you choose your own direction of travel. If your move ends in a space that has been occupied by another player, you occupy the next empty space.

Meeting mode

Difficulty level - 6/10
You win only when collect all animals you will meet - 15 animals - one card per each. You take adventure cards from the pile of cards only after you have finished moving on the field with the box.
But be careful, if you lose on action fields - ants, bees, swamp, rock pillar, suspension bridge and ponds, you lose all collected card.
When you end your move on basket with food, next turn you will begin on camp and lose all equipment cards and map card.
All your lost cards you need to return the bottom of the pile of cards.

Card mode - strategic

Difficulty level – 9/10
This mode offers the possibility of strategic thinking and planning, but the game time increases significantly, so it is recommended for players who like the highest level of difficulty in games.
In this mode, you play the base game.
During the game, you only use the dice when you encounter animals. In this mode, you use movement cards to move around the board - cards marked with dice.
At the beginning of the game, shuffle the movement cards and deal 5 cards to all players so that the other players cannot see them. Leave the rest of the cards on the pile.

During your turn, you may use one of your cards to move and reveal it to the players. However, if neither card meets your strategic plans, you choose the first move card in the pile, which ultimately determines your move.
Each used movement card is returned to the bottom of the movement deck.
After you have used all your movement cards, on the next turn, you take the first 5 cards from the pile and continue the game.

boardgame.name: Koinz
boardgame.description:
Simple coin (Koin) stacking, area control game. Players alternate playing Koinz onto 1-4 Surfaces with the goal of capturing each Surface by accumulating the most points on that Surface. The first player to capture five Surfaces wins. Each round takes about five minutes. Players get to choose how many Koinz and surfaces are used in each round and strategy will change based on these choices.

This game is set for release in July 2022.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Centurion
boardgame.description:
Players start the game by placing their Centurion in one of the two middle squares on their side of the game-board. Two Legionnaires are then placed next to the Centurion. Each turn a player may choose to randomly draw a new tile from the bag or move a tile already in play.

The innovative game-play feature at the heart of CENTURION are its double-sided PROFILE SYSTEM tiles. Each side represents a different posture--often considered defensive or offensive--and indicates exactly what the piece can do within the turn. At the end of a move (or use of a special ability) the tile is flipped to its other side, displaying a new offensive or defensive profile. Each maneuver profile conveys a file's different options for movement and attack. The full circle is standard Move, a hollow circle the Jump, an arrow provides for the Slide, the star a special Strike ability and so on. Defend your own troops while positioning yourself to capture your opponent's Duke, Jarl or Centurion tiles.

With thirteen different double-sided Soldier tiles and nineteen total pieces for each player, every game of CENTURION brings different challenges requiring new strategies. Add to that players can choose to play asymmetrically with the sets from The Duke, Jarl, or CENTURION, battling among all three armies. The variety of play is limitless.

boardgame.name: Mango City
boardgame.description:
The Town of the Magno Trees

Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to Mango City, the Mango Trees Town! This book will help you to setting a campaign for Beat Boys RPG or any other Beat'em Up like style games you wish (solo or group TTRPG). You'll find here all kinds of useful information about locations, gangs, events on these location, neon lights and much colorful pages! Get your Walkman charged, put your favorite k7 mixtape and get on the streets to beat ninjas, samurais, robots & other crazy stuff you want!

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex – Death Guard
boardgame.description:
The Death Guard are the greatest champions of the Plague God, Grandfather Nurgle, his favoured spreaders of his bounteous gifts. Look upon them and see the signs: pus seeping from festering wounds that never heal; miasmic smogs of corrosive, stinking gas hanging thickly in the air wherever Nurgle’s chosen tread; the wriggling, lamprey-mouthed tick-leeches that clamp on to their rotting flesh; the droning billions of plague flies that swarm the battlefields they stalk and the ships in which they course through the stars.

Few armies offer such a rich canvas for painting and modelling as the Death Guard. Every miniature is riddled with gruesome details and grisly flourishes, showing the blessings they have received from Nurgle, and in turn how they will spread the Lord of Decay’s infections. With them you can craft a truly head turning – not to mention stomach turning – force that can terrify your enemies and be disgustingly powerful on the battlefield. This book is the ultimate guide to the Death Guard, featuring in depth lore and background and the rules that you need to field them in Warhammer 40,000.

Inside this book, you'll find:

– Background on the reunification of Mortarion with the Death Guard during the Great Crusade, his eventual fall into heresy, and the process inflicted upon the Death Guard as Nurgle's Destroyer Plague took them.
– Information on the organisational structure of the Death Guard following the Horus Heresy and how their cohesion meant they were better able to enact war upon the galaxy.
– Incredible photography of units, single miniatures, and armies on terrain, both on their own and as part of battle scenes.
– Datasheets that cover every unit fieldable by a Death Guard army.
– Death Guard-specific Stratagems, Warlord Traits, Relics, and psychic powers.
– In-depth Crusade rules that let you grow your force as it spreads diseases and plague across the galaxy.
– And more!
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex Heretic Astartes – Death Guard

boardgame.name: The Castle of Sanguine Blight
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

5th of September 1846. Your investigation has led you to the inhospitable Moldavian mountains. Haunted by nightmares and without assistance from the local populace, which have shunned your very presence since you explained your travel’s destination, you have now arrived at the end of your journey. The isolated Castle Vojvod. As you gaze upon the castle, the home of Countess Elisabeth de Bemeur, you know that the final answers you seek will be inside, if you can survive its horrors…

The Castle of Sanguine Blight is a dark solo adventure card game, created as a love letter to the Castlevania and Shadowgate videogames, Cthulhu by Gaslight RPG and classic Gothic horror. Choose between 4 doomed characters, face 30 eerie rooms and 30 blood dripping events and acquire 12 weird items that may help you on the way to defeat the vampire and its 9 horrible attacks. Replay and experience a different castle the next time. Or why not use the cards as inspiration, when you need a fateful turn of events for your regular RPG session.

boardgame.name: Pew Pew! For a Few Credits More
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Pew Pew! is a one-shot tabletop RPG for up to seven players (and one GM).
...

It's a rules-light roleplaying game, with everything you need to play (aside from dice and friends).



It's light-hearted and intended for one shots; this isn't a story about deep-seated emotional turmoil and tortured introspection.



It's also great for new gamers, or playing online, because it's easy to pick up and quick to play.



It's a game about explosions and loads of big fights and ray guns and, maybe, maybe laser swords. It's an excellent game to run at conventions or as an emergency pick-up game, because all the prep is already done – it's baked into the system.
boardgame.rpg: Pew Pew! Bounty Hunters in Space

boardgame.name: Oppai Go: Fantastic Breasts and Where to Find Them
boardgame.description:
The success of the Oppai Go tournament has even reached the realm of Tengu, animal gods that have been watching over Japan for centuries. Four animal-featured girls have decided to walk the Earth and compete in the funniest strip challenge in human history. Make your purr… uhm, better!

The goal of the game is to have the most victory points at the end. Players get VP by stripping their opponents of their clothes (or accessories).

The accessory token moves from one space to another to denote the state of dress of each character. The possible states are as follows:
1. Naked: The accessory token is off the character sheet and the character is flipped to the naked side
2. Pants: The character is only wearing pants (token on pants space)
3. Bra: The character is wearing bra and pants (token on bra space)
4. Armor: The character is wearing bra and pants, and also armor (token on armor space)
5. Weapon: The character has a weapon, armor, bra and panties (token on weapon space)

The game is divided into rounds, each round is split into phases. Note that some phases are played in clockwise order and some others in anticlockwise order.

Each player faces a round always with 3 cards in hand, drawing them from the central common deck. Cards could have some effects like removing accessories to an opponent (or to everyone), gain 1 accessory, defend from opposing actions, etc.

The cards can be played by the hand, can be held (covered) on the table (to be played during the next rounds) or can be discarded. All played cards form a sort of pile in order to activate their effects from the last played card to the first one.

The held cards go always on the top of the pile, so their effects start first. There's only one problem: the card on the top of the discard pile determines the Seed, that is the color of cards that cannot be played among the held ones.

This is a game full of funny surprises, bluff, ruthless combos and embarrassing situations.

This is a new version of Oppai Go that is stand alone but can be combined with the previous game to extend games up to 5-6 players.

boardgame.name: Pet Wars
boardgame.description:
Pet Wars is a boardgame for two players that is free to print and play. Players control either the Kids or the Pets. Your goal as the Kids is to keep the house in good shape and keep the pets from wrecking the place. The Pets attempt to destroy as much stuff as they can and make a huge mess. Players only have 10 turns to accomplish their goals as best as possible.

The Pets will consist of four dogs and four cats. The dogs and cats can eat food, then poo and pee in the house, or leave muddy footprints, which all earn points at the end if not cleaned up by the kids. Dogs can break things and chew stuff up, cats can shred stuff and knock things over. Cuz Cats.

The Kids have a Babysitter, Brother, Sister, and a baby. Each kids has a special power. The biggest dog will always protect the baby, and follow the baby around. The sister likes to chase the cats, and can drive them away. The brother and babysitter can fix and clean stuff, and wrangle the dogs.

At the end of 10 turns, the parents get home. The side that scores the most points at the end wins. That's the general gist of it, there is a floorplan of the house, standees, counters and player mats to keep track of your side's abilities.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: F-Life: A Card Game About Adulthood
boardgame.description:
F-Life: A Game About Adulthood is a dark-humored party card game about life and all of the terrible things that happen to us all.

Each player begins at a young age based on their chosen education level. As you age, you draw many different types of cards that can change everything. The goal is to collect the most amount of money until you die. Once everyone dies, the player with the most money wins!

Grow old as you work and earn money. Get too old, and you'll hit retirement. Ahh, shit! Did you die? That's okay. Continue playing from the graveyard and use cards to screw over the remaining players that are still alive.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Campaign Trail (Second Edition): Kickstarter Edition
boardgame.description:
This edition of Campaign Trail includes Timed Releases and a larger box and tray designed to also contain the Green Party Expansion. Additionally, some components have been changed (e.g. animeeples instead of meeples in the deluxe version), and the Social Media Post action has been tweaked.

Note: It also no longer contains the Dirty Politics Module which has instead been made available separately.

Campaign Trail is a strategy board game in which players pit their campaign skills against one another as they vie for the Presidency of the United States.

The confetti is flying, the champagne is flowing, and you have just accepted your party's nomination for President of the United States. Now it's time to hit the Campaign Trail! How will you chart your path to victory? Engage in grass roots campaigning, advertise, sling mud at opponents, fundraise, debate, and so much more! But be sure to avoid revealing those skeletons you have buried in your closet. The candidate who best manages their resources and connects with the public on key issues will win the presidency!

Campaign Trail uses card driven actions to implement your strategy. Your goal is to have the most voters for your party in enough states to win a majority of electoral votes. If you have the most voters in a state you are awarded that state's electoral votes (victory points). At the end of the game the player with the most electoral votes wins and is declared the president!
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Campaign Trail (Second Edition with Green Party Expansion)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Campaign Trail (Second Edition): Green Party Expansion
Campaign Trail: Green Party Expansion – Game Boy Geek 2021 Promo Cards
Campaign Trail: Saxophone Serenade On Late Night TV
Campaign Trail: That Geek from the Media
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Campaign Trail: Timed Releases Promo Pack

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex Supplement – Blood Angels
boardgame.description:
The Blood Angels are the beatific sons of Sanguinius, the Great Angel. Inside this 80-page hardback codex supplement, you'll find everything you need to unleash the Blood Angels in battle, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this book, you'll find:

- The history of the Blood Angels, with a look at how their valiant defence of Terra and loss of their Primarch at the hands of the Arch-traitor Horus forever changed their fate
- A detailed description of Chapter organisation and iconography
- A Blood Angels bestiary with background details for every unit and Character featured
- A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
- Rules for units that are only available to the Blood Angels Chapter and their successors – including 18 datasheets
- Stratagems, the Sanguinary psychic discipline, Relics, and optional secondary objectives that define the ways that the Blood Angels wage war
- Bespoke Crusade rules providing new Agendas, Requisitions, Battle Traits, Honorifics, and Crusade Relics that are unique to the Blood Angels
- And more!

You will need a copy of Codex: Space Marines and the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook to use the rules included in this codex supplement.

boardgame.name: Warhammer 40,000 (Ninth Edition): Codex Supplement – Dark Angels
boardgame.description:
None fight with more grim determination than the battle-brothers of the Dark Angels, and their renowned specialised companies – the Deathwing and the Ravenwing – are held in awe by their allies and enemies alike. Working in concert, the formations of the Dark Angels are devastating in battle. Yet behind their devotion to the Imperium lies a shadowy obsession. Haunted by their past, the Dark Angels and their successors – known collectively as the Unforgiven – wage a secret war for redemption, a millennia-long crusade of vengeance that will either lead to their final atonement… or eternal damnation.

Inside this 80-page hardback codex supplement, you'll find everything you need to hunt the Fallen with your Dark Angels, plus thrilling lore and art to inspire your own collection.

Inside this book, you'll find:

- The history of the Dark Angels, exploring their glorious rise and tragic fall, and the secretive hunt that has driven them for ten thousand years
- A detailed description of Chapter organisation and iconography
- A Dark Angels bestiary with background details for every unit and Character featured
- A showcase of stunningly painted Citadel miniatures
- Rules for units that are only available to the Dark Angels Chapter and their successors – including 23 datasheets
- Stratagems, the Interromancy psychic discipline, Relics, and optional secondary objectives that define the ways that the Dark Angels wage war
- Bespoke Crusade rules providing new Agendas, Requisitions, Battle Traits, Honorifics, and Crusade Relics for the Dark Angels, as well as rules for hunting the Fallen
- And more!

You will need a copy of Codex: Space Marines and the Warhammer 40,000 rulebook to use the rules included in this codex supplement.
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: Warhammer 40,000 (Eighth Edition): Codex Adeptus Astartes – Dark Angels

boardgame.name: Prison Island Kancarra
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This adventure takes place as the players make their way to the infamous Island Fortress, Kancarra, in which the players will have a specific mission as directed by one of the included Adventure Hooks! Not only that, but players can start the adventure from inside the prison cells within, meaning this module can either function as an infiltration or a jailbreak! How the players get captured - and for what purpose - can be written in to your own campaign setting. A nefarious plot by the Big Bad of your game? A direct result of the players violating the law? Or maybe the players were framed for a crime they didn't commit? The choice is yours!

boardgame.name: The Brotherhood of Flame
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The enigmatic cultists that were terrorizing the Ka'shaar Region are back! Designed to be both a sequel to The Dragon Shrine of Ka'shaar OR a standalone adventure, this module takes the players into the Brotherhood of Flame's signature Flame Temple to defeat the Brotherhood and their mysterious leader. Players will have to fight for their lives against the cultists, their strange fire magic, and the dangers of the very temple itself! Select NPCs from The Dragon Shrine of Ka'shaar will make their return, aiding the players in their last stand against the ultimate threat. Hope your players brought some fire resistance!

boardgame.name: The Haunting of Belford Manor
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Coming across a strange mansion in the outskirts of town, the players will have to solve the mansion's riddles to discover the disturbing truth of what happened underneath… This horror-themed module will test your players' problem-solving, as they explore the mysterious mansion, which gradually opens up further as the players solve the puzzles within.

boardgame.name: The Mystical Hourglass and The Town Trapped In Time
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The players come to an idyllic rural town, where nothing seems out of the ordinary. That is, until they wake up the next morning, and find the townsfolk around them reliving the exact same day over again... The strange town is stuck in time, cursed to repeat the same day endlessly. Can strange curse be undone before it's too late? Or will time - quite literally - be running out for the players?

boardgame.name: The Tournament of Might
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The players receive an invitation to a combat and sporting tournament, held in a major city of your campaign. From all over the globe, competitors (and your NPCs!) will be competing for the top prize - but only after a winner survives through multiple rounds of the tournament! This rules-lite module focuses on a fun, roleplay-heavy tournament, where characters can enter in whichever contest suits their character; ending, of course, ending with an all-out combat between the finalists!

boardgame.name: SideQuests Vol. IV
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

SideQuests are a collection of short adventures designed for Fifth Edition. These one-shot style campaigns are designed to be compelling standalone stories that can be implemented, played through, and completed in just a few sessions. Whether you're using them as a filler adventure between major story arcs, as a continuation of your own adventures, or just because you forgot to plan the session last Wednesday... SideQuests are an invaluable tool for any DM!

This digital PDF bundle constitutes the fourth collection of SideQuests adventures:


The Haunting of Belford Manor
The Mystical Hourglass and The Town Trapped In Time
The Tournament of Might
The Brotherhood of Flame
Prison Island Kancarra


A collection of hi-res Battlemaps is also included.

boardgame.name: Cavern Basic Set B
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Cavern Basic group of Naked Geomorphs contains 15 tiles, each with one multi-position opening (CD, CSD, CSSD, etc.) and the remaining positions filled with rock (R). Sets A, B, C and D are completely interchangeable. I.e., tile C1A can be replaced with tile C1B, tile C1C or tile C1D, without changing the basic structure of your map.

boardgame.name: Cavern Basic Set D
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Cavern Basic group of Naked Geomorphs contains 15 tiles, each with one multi-position opening (CD, CSD, CSSD, etc.) and the remaining positions filled with rock (R). Sets A, B, C and D are completely interchangeable. I.e., tile C1A can be replaced with tile C1B, tile C1C or tile C1D, without changing the basic structure of your map.

boardgame.name: Cavern Passage Set A
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Cavern Passage group of Naked Geomorphs contains 19 tiles, each with two or more joined multi-position openings (CD, CSD, CSSD, etc.) and the remaining positions filled with rock (R). Sets A and B are completely interchangeable. I.e., tile C16A can be replaced with tile C16B, without changing the basic structure of your map. Set A has more complex outlines than Set B, with narrow protrusions and indentations.

boardgame.name: Cavern Wall Set B
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Cavern Wall group of Naked Geomorphs contains 22 tiles, each with two or more unjoined multi-position openings (CD, CSD, CSSD, etc.) and the remaining positions filled with rock (R). Some tiles have three multi-position openings, two of which are joined into a passage. Sets A and B are completely interchangeable. I.e., tile C35A can be replaced with tile C35B, without changing the basic structure of your map.

boardgame.name: Cavern-Tunnel Passage Set B (Small Cavern)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Cavern-Tunnel Passage (small cavern) group of Naked Geomorphs contains 12 tiles, each with one two-position opening (CD) and a connected tunnel opening (T), with the three remaining positions filled with rock (R). Sets A, B and C are completely interchangeable. I.e., tile M1B can be replaced with tile M1A or tile M1C, without changing the basic structure of your map. Set B has broad passages without narrow restrictions.

boardgame.name: Cavern-Tunnel Passage Set C (Small Cavern)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Cavern-Tunnel Passage (small cavern) group of Naked Geomorphs contains 12 tiles, each with one two-position opening (CD) and a connected tunnel opening (T), with the three remaining positions filled with rock (R). Sets A, B and C are completely interchangeable. I.e., tile M1C can be replaced with tile M1A or tile M1B, without changing the basic structure of your map. Set C has sections of narrow, one-hex wide, passages with deadend branches.

boardgame.name: Cavern-Tunnel Passage Set A (Large Cavern)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Cavern-Tunnel Passage (large cavern) group of Naked Geomorphs contains 18 tiles, each with one three-or-more position opening (CSD, CSSD, etc.) and a connected tunnel opening (T), with the remaining positions filled with rock (R). Sets A and B are completely interchangeable. I.e., tile M13A can be replaced with tile M13B, without changing the basic structure of your map. Set A has sections of narrow, one-hex wide, passages.

boardgame.name: Cavern-Tunnel Passage Set B (Large Cavern)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Cavern-Tunnel Passage (large cavern) group of Naked Geomorphs contains 18 tiles, each with one three-or-more position opening (CSD, CSSD, etc.) and a connected tunnel opening (T), with the remaining positions filled with rock (R). Sets A and B are completely interchangeable. I.e., tile M13B can be replaced with tile M13A, without changing the basic structure of your map. Set B has broad passages without narrow restrictions.

boardgame.name: Cavern-Tunnel Wye Set B (Small Cavern)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Cavern-Tunnel Wye (small cavern) group of Naked Geomorphs contains 27 tiles, each with three connected openings, one or two of which are two-position openings (CD) and the remainder tunnel openings (T). Sets A and B are completely interchangeable. I.e., tile M31B can be replaced with tile M31A, without changing the basic structure of your map. Set B has broad passages with few restricted areas.

boardgame.name: Cavern-Tunnel Wye Set A (Large Cavern)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Cavern-Tunnel Wye (large cavern) group of Naked Geomorphs contains 18 tiles, each with three connected openings, one or two of which are three-or-more position openings (CSD, CSSD, etc.) and the remainder tunnel openings (T). Sets A and B are completely interchangeable. I.e., tile M58A can be replaced with tile M58B, without changing the basic structure of your map. Set A has some sections of narrow, one-hex wide, passages, although not all passages are so restricted.

boardgame.name: Cavern Basic and Tunnel Passage Set A (Large Cavern)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Cavern Basic and Tunnel Passage (large cavern) group of Naked Geomorphs contains 12 tiles, each with three openings, one of which is an unconnected three-or-more position opening (CSD, CSSD, etc.) and the other two are a pair of connected tunnel openings (T). Sets A and B are completely interchangeable. I.e., tile M94A can be replaced with tile M94B, without changing the basic structure of your map. Set A has lots of narrow, one-hex wide, passages, with some blind branches.

boardgame.name: Cavern-Tunnel Multiple Passages Set A
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Cavern-Tunnel Multiple Passages group of Naked Geomorphs contains 18 tiles, each with one cavern opening (CD, CSD) and three or more connected tunnels (T). Sets A and B are completely interchangeable. I.e., tile M106A can be replaced with tile M106B, without changing the basic structure of your map. Set A has lots of narrow, one-hex wide, passages branching off the larger cavern area.

boardgame.name: Cavern-Tunnel Multiple Passages Set B
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Cavern-Tunnel Multiple Passages group of Naked Geomorphs contains 18 tiles, each with one cavern opening (CD, CSD) and three or more connected tunnels (T). Sets A and B are completely interchangeable. I.e., tile M106B can be replaced with tile M106A, without changing the basic structure of your map. Set B has broad, two-hex wide, tunnel passages branching off the larger cavern area.

boardgame.name: Open Space with Rocks Set B
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Open Space with Rocks group of Naked Geomorphs contains 8 tiles, each with open space (S) at all six positions, and islands of rock. Sets A and B are completely interchangeable. Indeed, all tiles of this group are interchangeable. Tile S1B can be replaced with tile S1A or tile S8B without changing the basic structure of your map. Set B has somewhat larger rocky islands than Set A.

boardgame.name: Tunnel Passage Set B
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Tunnel Passage group of Naked Geomorphs contains 12 tiles, each with a pair of connected tunnel entrances (T), and rock (R) at the remaining four positions. There are actually nine different interconnection patterns; this group contains two tiles for each pattern where the tunnel positions are adjacent, because those are so useful as edge and corner tiles. Sets A and B are completely interchangeable. I.e., tile T77A can be replaced with tile T77B, without changing the basic structure of your map. Set B has broader tunnels than set A, with no one-hex-wide constrictions in the main passage and occasional small offshoots.

boardgame.name: Tunnel Passage and Deadend Set B
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Tunnel Passage and Deadend group of Naked Geomorphs contains 30 tiles, each with a pair of connected tunnel entrances (T), another deadend tunnel entrance (T), and rock (R) at the three remaining positions. Sets A and B are completely interchangeable. I.e., tile T89 can be replaced with tile T89A ithout changing the basic structure of your map. Set A has broader tunnels than set B, with no one-hex-wide constrictions.

boardgame.name: Tunnel Wye Set B
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Tunnel Wye group of Naked Geomorphs contains 13 tiles, each with three connected tunnel entrances (T), and rock (R) at the remaining three positions. There are actually ten different interconnection patterns; this group contains two tiles for each pattern where all three tunnel positions are adjacent, because those are so useful as edge and corner tiles. Sets A and B are completely interchangeable. I.e., tile T137B can be replaced with tile T137A, without changing the basic structure of your map. Set B has broader tunnels than set A, with no one-hex-wide constrictions in the main passages and an occasional narrow deadend branch.

boardgame.name: Tunnel Wye and Passage Set A
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Tunnel Wye and Passage group of Naked Geomorphs contains 15 tiles, each with a trio and a pair of connected tunnel entrances (T), and rock (R) at the remaining position. Sets A and B are completely interchangeable. I.e., tile T150A can be replaced with tile T150B, without changing the basic structure of your map. Set A has narrower tunnels than set B, with lots of one-hex-wide passages and a few small to medium galleries.

boardgame.name: Tunnel Wye and Passage Set B
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Tunnel Wye and Passage group of Naked Geomorphs contains 15 tiles, each with a trio and a pair of connected tunnel entrances (T), and rock (R) at the remaining position. Sets A and B are completely interchangeable. I.e., tile T150B can be replaced with tile T150A, without changing the basic structure of your map. Set B has broad, unconstricted passages.

boardgame.name: Małe Epickie Podziemia
Pequeñas Grandes Mazmorras
Tiny Epic Dungeons
타이니 에픽 던전
boardgame.description:
Tiny Epic Dungeons is a fully co-operative dungeon crawler for 1 to 4 players set in the fantasy world of Aughmoore.

In Tiny Epic Dungeons, players control a band of Heroes exploring a treacherous dungeon in search of the fearsome Dungeon Boss. Heroes make their way through the dungeon one room at a time. Around every corner goblins and ferocious minions seek to block the Heroes’ path. Where there isn’t an enemy, traps are set, ready to spring on even the most prepared Hero.

Tiny Epic Dungeons features a modular dungeon that is unique with each play.

The game is played over two acts: The Dungeon, and the Dungeon Boss. In both acts, the players are constantly struggling against the waning firelight of their torch which decreases each turn. When the torch goes out, the Heroes are forever lost in the darkness.

After clearing the dungeon of all its' minions and finding the entrance to the lair, players must engage in an epic battle against the Boss. Each boss has unique abilities and a lair with a unique environment that gives various advantages and disadvantages depending on the skill used and where the Hero attacks from.

These Epic Monsters cannot be slain by mere swords, axes, arrows, and the occasional spell. Ritual Rooms around the dungeon must be used to lower their magical bond to the dungeon. The Dungeon boss must be lured to these rooms to lower their defenses and allow the Heroes to strike the final blow!

Victory in Tiny Epic Dungeons is achieved by defeating the Dungeon Boss! In order to do that, the Heroes will need to collect legendary loot, and supreme spells

Heroes of old crafted loot to honor the ways of their clans. Bear, Lion, Phoenix, and Panther. Heroes can discover pieces from these ancient sets that grow more powerful the more you collect.

Will you be the greatest warrior the Bear clan has ever seen? Or will you make the Panther clan proud by stalking your prey and striking with surprising force, unseen before the moment of impact?

The story is yours to tell in Tiny Epic Dungeons!

-description from publisher

New, in shrinkwrap!
Tiny Epic Dungeons: Deluxe Edition The Deluxe Edition includes: * * * the Potions and Perils mini expansion * * * all Deluxe Edition Stretch Goals * * * and Kickstarter Exclusive Content.
The Potions & Perils mini expansion brings a whole new element to the game in the way of Potions and the perilous alchemists that concoct them... the Mixy Goblins! Mixy Goblins are added directly to the goblin deck and are encountered like normal goblins. Except, they are not like normal goblins. When you defeat a Mixy Goblin, something explodes! You'll draw a Potion Card to see what the effect is. Each Potion Card will describe a peril that occurs when you kill a Mixy Goblin and will also leave you with a handy potion for use later!
Additionally, the mini expansion brings new Dungeon Bosses, Minions and Goblins to the game. Each presenting a unique challenge that will test even the best players!
Game Description: Tiny Epic Dungeons is a fully co-operative dungeon crawler for 1 to 4 players set in the fantasy world of Aughmoore.
In Tiny Epic Dungeons, players control a band of Heroes exploring a treacherous dungeon in search of the fearsome Dungeon Boss. Heroes make their way through the dungeon one room at a time. Around every corner goblins and ferocious minions seek to block the Heroes’ path. Where there isn’t an enemy, traps are set, ready to spring on even the most prepared Hero.
Tiny Epic Dungeons features a modular dungeon that is unique with each play.
The game is played over two acts: The Dungeon, and the Dungeon Boss. In both acts, the players are constantly struggling against the waning firelight of their torch which decreases each turn. When the torch goes out, the Heroes are forever lost in the darkness.
After clearing the dungeon of all its' minions and finding the entrance to the lair, players must engage in an epic battle against the Boss. Each boss has unique abilities and a lair with a unique environment that gives various advantages and disadvantages depending on the skill used and where the Hero attacks from.
These Epic Monsters cannot be slain by mere swords, axes, arrows, and the occasional spell. Ritual Rooms around the dungeon must be used to lower their magical bond to the dungeon. The Dungeon boss must be lured to these rooms to lower their defenses and allow the Heroes to strike the final blow!
Victory in Tiny Epic Dungeons is achieved by defeating the Dungeon Boss! In order to do that, the Heroes will need to collect legendary loot, and supreme spells
Heroes of old crafted loot to honor the ways of their clans. Bear, Lion, Phoenix, and Panther. Heroes can discover pieces from these ancient sets that grow more powerful the more you collect.
Will you be the greatest warrior the Bear clan has ever seen? Or will you make the Panther clan proud by stalking your prey and striking with surprising force, unseen before the moment of impact?
The story is yours to tell in Tiny Epic Dungeons!
-description from publisher

boardgame.name: D6Core Rules System Reference Document
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

D6Core is a free, Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0) licensed Table Top Role Playing system based on a sum dice pool mechanic rolled against a target modifier.

The base game is simple, but the options both in game can make the "crunchiness" of the game as much or as little as you could want.

We aim for "crunch medium" by default whether using miniatures on your table top or not.

boardgame.name: Auntie Foodies
boardgame.description:
Auntie Foodies is a fun game about local Singapore food with aunties combined. Compete against one another over a pot luck dinner setting and engage in a food combat! Use special cards to either benefit yourself or sabotage other players.

Players take their turn by contributing food on the play area and let other people consume it. But be careful, some players may sabotage you with the food that you taken. Special cards and condiments are there to make your stomach miserable so make sure to check before you take!

Players will have to consume a total of 20 points worth of food to win the game. If you go over, you exploded and lose the game.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Scrabble Duplicate
boardgame.description:
Scrabble Duplicate plays similar to Scrabble in that you're trying to create words from letter tiles that will score you more points than anyone else — but players are using the same letters each round and not everyone will place their words on the game board!

In more detail, the game includes one hundred letter tiles, as in the original Scrabble game. On a turn, someone flips seven letter tiles face up, then each player writes a word using some combination of these letters on their personal dry erase board, trying to score as many points as possible. You write down the score for your personal word, then whoever has the highest score uses the face-up tiles to place their word on the shared central game board. Everyone else then writes this word on their dry erase board in place of whatever they had.

You then refill the tiles so you again have seven face up, then each create a new word on your board, building off the word already there. Collectively you'll build a shared interlocking grid of words, but you're scoring individually for your creations. Who will up with the most points?

boardgame.name: Submarine Titans
boardgame.description:
Submarine Titans is a real-time strategy video game that takes place in the year 2115 after a comet has struck Earth,[1] driving two human factions, the militant White Sharks and the scientific Black Octopi,[2] to establish underwater bases and fight for dominance over the oceans.[3] The comet also brought a mysterious alien race known as the Silicons,[2] who compete with the two human factions to collect resources and build a gate that would take them back to their homeworld.[4] Each faction has its own ten-mission campaign, and the player can play the three campaigns in any order.[2]

With the exception of their technology trees, the human factions share many similarities and are functionally identical. However, the Silicons use a different resource model.[2] The White Sharks and Black Octopi require a supply of oxygen to power all their structures and must harvest metal and a special element called Corium to build submarines and facilities, while the Silicons must extract silicon from the sea floor to produce their basic resource and use metal to generate energy and power their regeneration ability. Nevertheless, they harvest Corium in the same way as the human factions do.[2]

Because the game takes place underwater, units can be moved up or down in relation to the sea floor, in addition to their movement in a two-dimensional direction. The terrain of the map, which can have hills, mountains and land bridges, affect how a base can be constructed and the movement of the player's units.[5] The game includes a level editor, allowing players to create their own maps.[6] It is also the first real-time strategy game to feature a spectator mode, which allows players to watch multiplayer matches without intervening in the gameplay.[7][8]

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Submarine_TITANS Submarine TITANS]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Time Gate: Knight's Chase
boardgame.description:
Time Gate: Knight's Chase (or just Knight's Chase) is a puzzle-solving game by Infogrames released 1996 for MS-DOS and Microsoft Windows.

The gameplay is similar to the Alone in the Dark series of games. The game uses a modified engine of the first three Alone in the Dark games, featuring Gouraud-shaded, rather than flat shaded, polygons.

Knight's Chase was the first game in a planned trilogy of Time Gate video games.[1]

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time_Gate%3A_Knight%27s_Chase Time Gate: Knight's Chase]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Color Addict Fruity
boardgame.description:
The object of the game is to discard all your cards as quickly as possible. Each player has a face-down draw pile and takes three cards from it into her hand. When all players have drawn three cards, the dealer places the top card of her draw pile face up in the center of the table, thus starting the game. Players may discard their cards accordingly if any of the following rules apply:

The background of the card is the same color as the word on the card
The background matches the pattern of the fruit
The word on the card is the same as the fruit
The word on the card matches the word on the card
The fruit choice card is played

boardgame.name: Color Addict Drinks
boardgame.description:
Do bright colors make you dizzy? Here's the "Drinks" version of the fast-paced discard game Color Addict. Play your cards as fast as you can by matching drinks backgrounds, names, both, or vice versa.... There is no order, because everyone plays at the same time. So not only speed is needed, but also a good eye. With 10 different drinks, such as Mojito, Cuba Libre or Bloody Mary and motifs, the possibilities are almost endless. Ideal for the very late evening or the very early morning... or both! But beware. You want to have a good time, so don't drink too much or you'll get sick! Cheers!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Robotech: Reconstruction
boardgame.description:
Four Factions vying with each other to mold earth into their own vision. The Robotech Defense Force (RDF) seeks to keep the peace between Zentraedi civilians and humans. The Zentraedi Rebellion (ZR) wants to radicalize the Zentraedi civilians to join their rebellion to enslave humanity and the Earth. Tired of RDF military control and martial law, the Anti-Unification League (AUL) strives to rebuild thriving cities independent from the RDF. Fearing an impending alien attack on earth, the Robotech Expeditionary Force (REF) works to unite earth’s population behind the RDF in preparation for earth’s future defense.

To win, you must lead your faction to meet its goals before other factions achieve their own goals. You have a half-ally, a half-enemy, and a full enemy. You must work carefully to ensure you can reach your goals, but also ensure that no other Faction can stop you.

The 3 to 4 player game consists of up to 4 rounds. At the start of a turn, a player can can trade one event card with another player. Next players play 1 Event Card. Each Event Card is tied to a Faction, enabling that faction to take additional actions that round. After the Event Card's actions are completed, the player gets to Take Command to undertake two actions. Actions available are limited if the player elected on their turn to play their own Faction’s Event Card before Taking Command.

Players gain random and predetermined Event Cards as
the game progresses. After all players / Factions in a round complete their turn, there is a Resolution Phase where all Factions get to take additional actions.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Ep 92: A Conversation with Austin Smokowicz about Robotech Reconstruction

boardgame.name: The Cardistry Game
boardgame.description: The Cardistry Game is a last man standing card game where players must perform cardistry in order to keep on playing. If you fail a cut, you lose cards from the deck you're performing with. If you don't have any more cards, you're out of the game. Last player at the table wins.

boardgame.name: Sirtet
boardgame.description:
Sirtet is a little 15 minutes abstract strategy game for 2 players, about harvest, sacrifice ... and colorful tetrominoes!

The game is played with 36 custom tiles. The players discard tiles to harvest new ones from the board, trying to collect the largest number of tiles of the same color.

The Sirtet Solo variant allows you to play the game as a solitaire.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Melvin's Delivery Dash
boardgame.description:
Melvin's Delivery Dash takes place in a large county with different areas within it. A city, lake, forest, beach, and residential neighborhoods.
There's an overabundance of packages being mailed out, but not enough people to deliver them on time. Your goal is to deliver more packages around the county than your opponents before time runs out.

When each player draws a Package card, the package size and color of the card determine where it has to be delivered. Players can move freely in almost any direction around the board as they head to the appropriate destination. When their package is delivered, they pull a new package and head to the next spot.
Landing on specially marked spaces gets you a delivery notice, which can help or hinder your progress, or of those around you.
Choosing the most efficient route, and deciding who to sabotage along the way with Delivery Notices, will influence who wins in the end.

boardgame.name: The Tournament at Alliáns
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Her Excellency Anthelia, Blood-Countess of Kergüs, has determined to amuse herself by holding a tournament in Alliáns: the final tournament to be held before the end of all things. All the noble families of her domain have been called to attend. For months, the tourney has progressed without a victor as hundreds of nobles sought renown. Now, their banners are tattered and their armor is soiled, and Anthelia risks growing bored.

A wealthy but titleless burgher has offered to pay a late-entrance fee for you to attend in their name so that they might gain favor with Her Excellency. There is rumored to be a prize for the champion so incredible that it has stilled even the most active of tongues: to be declared the legitimate heir of the Blood-Countess...

If your tabletop group is looking for an opportunity to engage in brutal tournament combat, to hobnob with all manner of nobles, to get the chance to be bombarded with adventure hooks, and potentially to win the heart of Anthelia herself ... this scenario/setting might be for you!

Don't need a tournament? Well, download it for the d66 noble participants, with an extra d6 table of connections one or more might have to your past.
